Line Sensors¶

class line_sensor.LineSensor(adc_Pin: pyb.Pin, num: int)¶

Single channel IR line sensor interface encapsulated in a Python class

Initializes a Line Sensor Object

Parameters:

  • adc_Pin – Analog input pin for line sensor

  • num – number associated with sensor

adc¶

Sensor ADC Object

black_val¶

Calibrated value for black

calibrate_black()¶

Calibrate the sensor to what value represents black

calibrate_white()¶

Calibrate the sensor to what value represents white

num¶

Number associated with sensor channel

read() → float¶

Read the light sensor and return a normalized value taking into account calibration

Returns:

Normalized light level between 0 and 1

Return type:

float

white_val¶

Calibrated value for white

class line_sensor.SensorArray(CNTRL: pyb.Pin, sensor_define: list[tuple[pyb.Pin, int]])¶

Multi-channel IR Line Sensor interface

Initializes a Line Sensor Array object

Parameters:

  • CNTRL – Sensor dimming control pin for line sensor array

  • sensor_define – List of tuples, (ADC Pin, number associated for each sensor)

CNTRL¶

Sensor dimming control pin

calibrate_all(color: str)¶

Calibrate sensors array for a specified color: (“white” or “black”)

Parameters:

color – String of either “black” or “white”, corresponding to what color is being calibrated for

dimm()¶

Reduce the emitting level of the light sensors array by 3.33%

dimm_lvl¶

Current Dimming level of the array

get_centroid() → float¶

Calculate the centroid of the distribution light array distribution

Returns:

centroid of the sensor readings

Return type:

float

read_all() → list[float]¶

Read the light sensor array and return normalized values, taking into account calibration

Returns:

List of floats of normalized light levels between 0 and 1 for each light sensor in the array

Return type:

list[float]

sensor_list¶

List of line sensors in the array

sensor_values¶

Most recent read sensor values

MECHA03 ROMI
